page.title: 08Working in West Bromwich
page.content: Manufacturing industry has almost disappeared.There are some firms producing springs but many of these are in decline,cutting staff and scrapping apprenticeships.An exception to this is a firm producing business stationary which employs 700 people.The District Hospital (1920 workers)and Sandwell Council (1900 workers)are the two largest employers in the area.Both employ men and women as full and part time workers.Other people work in local shops and in the main shopping centre.Some work in the twice weekly market.School leavers often have difficulty finding work and many join Government schemes to gain work experience.Several local firms recruit from such schemes.Adult unemployment averages 15% in a population of 300,000.Most employers accept union membership.
